Tompkins DA, Bigelow GE, Harrison JA, Johnson RE, Fudala PJ, Strain EC. Concurrent validation of the Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS) and single-item indices against the Clinical Institute Narcotic Assessment (CINA) opioid withdrawal instrument. Drug Alcohol Depend. 2009 Nov 1;105(1-2):154-9. doi: 10.1016/j.drugalcdep.2009.07.001. Epub 2009 Aug 3. PMID: 19647958; PMCID: PMC2774236.
Wesson DR, Ling W. The Clinical Opiate Withdrawal Scale (COWS). J Psychoactive Drugs. 2003 Apr-Jun;35(2):253-9. doi: 10.1080/02791072.2003.10400007. PMID: 12924748.

details.purpose: *To record individual COWS parameters and total score. (en)
details.use: *Use to record individual COWS parameters and total score as part of an objective and subjective opiate withdrawal assessment. (en)

details.purpose: To record individual COWS parameters and total score.
details.use: Use to record individual COWS parameters and total score as part of an objective and subjective opiate withdrawal assessment.

items.items: Assessment tool used to measures the severity of opiate withdrawal.
Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time.
Measure pulse rate after patient is sitting or lying down for 1 minute.
Sweating not accounted for by room temperature or patient activity over the last 0.5 hours.
If patient was having pain previously, only the additional component attributed to opiate withdrawal is scored.
Not accounted for by cold symptoms or allergies.
The total sum of each component parameter for COWS.
No report of chills or flushing
Subjective report of chills or flushing
Flushed or observable moistness on face
Beads of sweat on brow or face
Reports difficulty sitting still, but is able to do so
Frequent shifting or extraneous movements of legs/arms
Unable to sit still for more than a few seconds
Pupils pinned or normal size for room light
Pupils possibly larger than normal for room light
Pupils so dilated that only the rim of the iris is visible
Patient reports severe diffuse aching of joints/ muscles
Patient is rubbing joints or muscles and is unable to sit still because of discomfort
Nasal stuffiness or unusually moist eyes
Nose constantly running or tears streaming down cheeks
Multiple episodes of vomiting or diarrhea
Tremor can be felt, but not observed
Yawning once or twice during assessment
Yawning three or more times during assessment
Patient reports increasing irritability or anxiousness
Patient so irritable or anxious that participation in the assessment is difficult
Piloerection of skin can be felt or hairs standing up on arms
Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms.
For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR.
*Assessment tool used to measures the severity of opiate withdrawal. (en)
*Default, unspecified point in time or interval event which may be explicitly defined in a template or at run-time. (en)
*Measure pulse rate after patient is sitting or lying down for 1 minute. (en)
*Sweating not accounted for by room temperature or patient activity over the last 0.5 hours. (en)
*If patient was having pain previously, only the additional component attributed to opiate withdrawal is scored. (en)
*Not accounted for by cold symptoms or allergies. (en)
*The total sum of each component parameter for COWS. (en)
Flush eller synlig fuktighet i ansikte
Säger sig ha svårt att sitta still men kan göra det
Frekvent skiftning av position eller överdrivet rörelsemönster med armar/ben
Oförmögen att sitta still längre än ett par sekunder
Nålstora eller av rimlig storlek med tanke på ljus i rummet
Möjligen förstorade givet ljus i rummet
Dilaterade till den grad att endast kanten av iris synd
Patienten rapporterar svår diffus ben- eller ledvärk
Patienten gnider ben eller leder alternativt är oförmögen att sitta still på grund av värk
Konstant rinnande näsa eller flödande tårar
Tremor kan kännas men ej observeras
Gäspar en eller två gånger under utvärdering
Gäspar tre eller fyra gånger under utvärdering
Patienten rapporterar ökande irritabilitet eller ångest
Patienten är uppenbart irritabel eller ängslig
Irritabel eller ängslig till den grad att medverkan är svår
Piloerektion kan kännas, alternativt stående hårstrån
*Additional information required to extend the model with local content or to align with other reference models or formalisms. (en)
*For example: local information requirements; or additional metadata to align with FHIR. (en)
